fields.description:
We have just experienced very strange behavior.

A child option was being added to a custom cascading select, and all child options now appear under a different parent on the edit issue page.

Note that on the ‘Edit Custom Field Options’ page, ironically all of the fields are appropriately aligned with the parent option.

At the same time, a custom user field was marked as required, now all the data is not appearing.

Please help, this is a huge problem.
fields.summary: Cascading select  - parent/child mismatched on edit/create screen

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5645].
  {panel}

A user reports:

When attempting to add a CVS module, I get the following error:

Error parsing cvs log: RCS filename 'c:\cvs\welfare\ant/.classpath,v' does not start with the provided root 'c:\cvs\welfare/ant'

Note the slashes separating "c:\cvs\welfare" (our CVS repository path) and "ant" (the module name). The CVS log contains back slashes (\) while the "provided root" contains a forward slash \(/).

I confirmed that the log file contains back slashes. A command line cvs log command reports backslashes.

The slash in the "provided root" is (I believe) put there by Jira. When entering the details in the "Add CVS module" screen, the "CVS Root" and "Module Name" are entered separately.

Is there a parameter somewhere which tells Jira that we are using CVS/CVSNT on Windows (ie use back slashes) rather than CVS on Unix/Linux (ie use forward slashes). Jira has to match what CVS reports, so Jira needs to know how CVS is reporting the file names. An alternative would be to use slash-independent string comparison,
fields.summary: Error parsing CVS log: wrong slash when using CVSNT

fields.description:
I understand that based on your findings from over a year ago.  That JIRA does not display correctly, if at all, under JRun4.  But, since that time.  The Devs for SiteMesh has confirmed that JRun4's Updater 4 has fixed the issue between SiteMesh and JRun4.

As such I was willing to give it a chance, and see if JIRA would work properly under JRun w/Updater 4.

But, I have found that JIRA produces a NPE error with every attempt to deploy it under JRun4 w/Updater 4.

I have attempted deploying all three Editions of JIRA v3.0.3 with using MSSQL and hsqldb.  And I have attempted various jrun-resouces.xml & entityengine.xml settings.  And all attempts ended with the exact same error message and stack trace.

fields.description:
For many administration Tasks would be meaningful to have tools for automatically up to date or/and changes in the Jira environment. Unfortunately the JellyTags are very difficult task and developer needs a lot of time for this script - language. More case i.e “for each..” tag don’t working correctly. I will proposal it it possible that Jira-Team provided more example Scripts with JellyTag.

My second question:

How I can use “regular expression” with JellyTags”? 

In my view, if we have a lot of projects i.e. with prefix “GW….” We can easy administrate more projects.



Mit freundlichen Grüßen / Best regards / Saludos 
_______________________________________ 
Hari Maslic 
Project Leader
GFT Technologies AG 

Düsseldorfer Straße 13 
D-65760 Eschborn

2005-01-12 13:07:14,979 ERROR [atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager] Could not get workflow called: New Development Life Cycle workflow: com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Error in workflow descriptor: New Development Life Cycle workflow: root cause: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity. (line:1280 col:24)
com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Error in workflow descriptor: New Development Life Cycle workflow: root cause: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity. (line:1280 col:24)
    at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.JiraWorkflowFactory.loadJiraWorkflow(JiraWorkflowFactory.java:186)

fields.description:
Consider that "admin" has "create issues, modify reporter" permissions; "johny" has "create issues" permissions;
I am logged in as "admin".

1) Following script runs successfuly but has no effect (issue is not created)

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
  <jira:Login username="admin" password="admin">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="SS" summary="Some desc" issueType="Bug" fixVersions="1.0" reporter="johny" />
  </jira:Login>   
</JiraJelly>

2) Trying this one I get (localized) message "you have no modify reporter permission"... 

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="SS" summary="Some desc" issueType="Bug" fixVersions="1.0" reporter="johny" />
</JiraJelly>

result:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib'>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>((summary=Some desc)(issuetype=1)(fixVersions=10050)(issueType=Bug)(reporter=johny)(project-key=SS)(priority=3)(pid=10050))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=johny</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>
Result=input
Nie masz uprawnień do zmiany zgłaszającego sprawę.
</ErrorMessage> 
  </Error>
</JiraJelly>

Who has to have this permission? 
a) "johny"? he creates issue, he does not "modify reporter"... he is reporter. Documentation says that "reporter" attribute is "The username of who is reporting this issue, the user is logged in and then the issue created".
b) "admin"? he has that permission (he is in "global-admins" group which is attached in "SS-ps" permission scheme as "modify reporter"; that scheme is used in "SS" project").

So... what is wrong?

BTW. Following script works because I need to create issues for testing purposes and I know johny's credentials:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
  <jira:Login username="johny" password="johnypass">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="SS" summary="Some desc" issueType="Bug" fixVersions="1.0" />
  </jira:Login>   
</JiraJelly>

fields.description:
The generated RSS content from issue navigator don't support XHTML latin characteres (http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/dtds.html#a_dtd_Latin-1_characters) during xml parse from a rss/xml utility.

The XML parse result the following error message: The entity "ecirc" was referenced, but not declared.

Other error messages occurs for other latin characteres entities like the instance described above.

Some issues content and site content contains XHTML automaticaly encoded characters that was persisted into the database (e.g. &ecirc;). Then, the generated rss content will be contains this characteres that aren't recognized by a rss/xml utility parser.

The attach contain a generated rss file that show the problem. This files contains entities not recognized like &ecirc; and &ccedil equivalents to the characters "ê" and "ç", respectively.

May be this issue affects other jira versions.
fields.summary: Generated RSS don't support latin entities during xml parse

fields.description:
The CVS Log Handler POPService doesn't appear to be working in the XDoclet JIRA at http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/  After committing a change nearly a week ago (that included the issue number, XDT-1218, in the Log Message), I still don't see the comment on the issue that the handler should have added.

My first thought was that maybe the POP3 mailbox it uses had filled up and the CVS log mail had bounced (as the handler doesn't clear out any messages other than the CVS ones), but on connecting to the mailbox directly with a POP3 client I saw this wasn't the case (I could see the Log mail in question waiting in the inbox).  I deleted the non-cvs mail messages anyway (it's about time it was done), upon which I noticed other CVS-generated mails in there going back a number of months.  It looks like the JIRA/CVS integration may not have been working for some time, but nobody noticed till now.

It was certainly working at the start of last year, and nothing has changed in the settings since then (still using the same server & mailbox, and the password hasn't changed).  I have a vague recollection that our JIRA went down and/or was upgraded earlier in the year, though, so I'm wondering if the CVS Log Handler service failed to start up again afterwards.  Could someone please check the logs to see if it's running okay (it ought to run every two hours)?  All the CVS emails are still queued up, so ought to be processed okay (if a bit late) once it's running again.

Lastly, a suggestion for a possible future enhancement for you consideration - how about adding something on to the Services administration screen in JIRA that shows for each service a) whether it is currently executing (when the page is served) and b) the time it last ran?  That would at least give some reassurance that JIRA's service scheduling is working okay.  Also, if there are any errors while running the service (e.g. the POP3 account is disabled or the password has been changed), can the errors in the last run be viewed anywhere in the admin screens?  That might save you from having to deal with more issues like this one in the future ;-)
fields.summary: CVS log POP3 integration not working in XDoclet's JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5608].
  {panel}

We're using a Non Quoted Comment Handler to add comments to issues via email. Some of our emails to JIRA users have bounced, leaving bounce messages from "System Administrator" in the mailbox. These messages cause the handler to write warnings to the stdout log. Over time, as these messages pile up in the mailbox, these log entries cause the log to ballon to 100mb+, which eventually results in the JIRA service throwing Out of Memory exceptions. I can imagine this would only be worse if say, virus infected clients were sending messages to the JIRA mailbox in question.

Possible solution:
+ Add an option to the handler "Delete messages from unauthorized mail senders"
+ Add a sub-option: "Log message body before deletion"
fields.summary: Make the PopService more failure tolerant

fields.description:
I failed to upgrade from 2.5.3 to 3.0.3. I decided to restore when I ran into classloading issues with JBoss.

Before upgrading I made a backup of my mysql database. I also upgraded my license through the administration pages. I assume the 3.0.3 license works with 2.5.3 and that this is not the course for my problems.

I restored by restoring my mysql database and then deploying the 2.5.3 ear file (after first removing the 3.0.3 ear file and stopping jboss).

Now when jboss starts up everything looks fine. I can see my projects and I can create new issues and recieve mails like before. On my project's page I can see the number of issues associated components and versions.

However, if I click on a link to see a list of issues (for example on a link for a component, a version or an issue status (open, closed etc)), then the list does not show the issues from before the restore. No problems with issues I create, I can view them.

I have looked in the database and it looks to be allright. My issues are located in the 'jiraissue' table and the associations found in 'nodeassociation' look allright. Old issues that is not associated a version or component is also not shown.

If I use the links that I have recieved by emails for the old issues the issue is shown so the issue it there. However, the association is somehow not correct eventhough the database seems to be alright.

The jboss log does not report any errors.

Do you have any idea of what is going on?

Best regards
Mads Pultz

fields.description: It looks like JIRA 3.0.3 may have a slow memory leak.  Our own site support.atlassian.com (6000 issues/comments, 676Mb) has occasionally died with OutOfMemoryErrors in the log, and a handful of users have reported similar experiences (3876 issues/comments 467Mb+).
fields.summary: Memory leak when services generate many errors in log

fields.description: Issue details view has missing translations as shown in attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Missing translations on issue details view

fields.description:
The following fails when nested inside a CreateIssue jelly tag:

<j:if test="${!contactIdValue.equals('')}">
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="${cfprefix}${vicontactcf.toString()}" value="${contactIdValue}"/>	
</j:if>

Using <j:when test="xxx"> seems to work ok.
fields.summary: AddCustomFieldValue: Fails if nested inside IF block

fields.description:
Not quite sure if this is a bug but i would expect same behaviour for displaying summary in viewIssue <-> roadmap,changelog...

Have a look at attached jpg or simply go to 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST?report=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project:changelog-panel
fields.summary: HTML in summary not escaped in portlets, roadmap

fields.description:
I would like to be able to search for issues that have
- no value set in a specific field
- the value in a number field larger than a specific number
- the value in a number field smaller than a specific number
- the value in a number field NOT equal to a specific value (could be a combination of the two previous)
- no due date set
- a due date earlier than a specific date OR no due date set

These capabilities do not seem to be there through the issue navigator.

I would recommend that you take a look at IBM/Rational ClearQuest, which provides a very flexible interface for defining searches/reports, where it almost exposes the SQL query directly. Maybe you should keep the current navigator as an easy tool for beginners, but augment it with a more flexible tool for administrators and advanced users?
fields.summary: Improved query functionality

fields.description: With Summaries like 'You forgot ', the "" is not escaped in the HTML mail. You can see the "" in subject line of the mail, but not in the Summary line in HTML mail.
fields.summary: Summary line in HTML mail is not properly escaped

fields.description: When using Jira with the default french locale, a user can not register. All data can be entered but when creating the user the register form is still displayed with blank passwords. No strange data is entered inside the fields, only plain ASCII.
fields.summary: User cannot register

fields.description:
We have a situation where a Bugzilla import created zero-byte attachments on disk, for all attachments that were under 512 bytes.  Possibly we are not flushing a buffer when writing the attachments.

So far this has only happened on Solaris.
fields.summary: Bugzilla attachments under 512 bytes not imported

fields.description: JIRA's CreateIssueHandler has a feature whereby if a valid JIRA user's email address is Cc'ed, that user becomes the issue assignee.  This behaviour should be configurable in the handler parameters.
fields.summary: Allow 'Cc the assignee' feature in CreateIssueHandler to be turned off

fields.description:
received the following error trying to add the first version to an existing project.

Please advise how to fix:

Could not create version: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Version][description,][project,10000][name,asd][sequence,1][id,10003] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO version (ID, PROJECT, vname, DESCRIPTION, SEQUENCE, RELEASED, ARCHIVED, URL, RELEASEDATE) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Disallowed implicit conversion from data type datetime to data type timestamp, table 'jira.jirauser.version', column 'RELEASEDATE'. Use the CONVERT function to run this query.))
fields.summary: Error creating Project Version

fields.description: If a workflow transition name contains an apostrophe, like "Won't fix", then on the transition screen JIRA refuses to update.  It appears we aren't escaping the string somewhere on that page.
fields.summary: Transition names can't contain apostrophes

fields.description: In JIRA, you can search for issues created within the previous X days, but not issues created earlier than X days ago.  What we really need is a relative range query, "created between 7 and 8 days ago".  This could be used to generate a daily list of issues that need responding to.
fields.summary: Allow relative range date searching (issues over X days old)
Let validators specify invalid field name

fields.description:
Readonly custom fields (such as Bugzilla ID) appear as if it will be removed during the move screen.

This doesn't actually occur and is quite misleading
fields.summary: Read-only custom field (e.g. Bugzilla id) appear deleted on move
Don't list old project on Move Issue screen

fields.description:
I am running a collection of scripts written about a year ago that worked in version 2.5.3 but is now having a problem when attempting to add a value to a global custom field. The first script creates the custom fields (or pulls their ids) and assigns those to a var. The second script creates issues for a given project and when referencing the var that is supposed to be the custom field it bombs. I will attach both scripts but here are the jelly script lines of interest:

[From import-customfields.jelly]
<jira:CreateCustomField fieldType="textfield" fieldScope="global" fieldName="${viidCFName}" description="${viidCFDescription}" customFieldIdVar="viidcf" searcher="textsearcher"/>

and

<j:set var="viidcf" value="${cf.get(0).getLong('id')}"/>

[From import-issues.jelly]
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="${viidcf.toString()}" value="${viid.toString()}"/>
fields.summary: Custom field id/name is not valid - jira:AddCustomFieldValue
